replies.body: You mean people have worked out how to play him. Now they know that his regen passive keeps him safe in lane and maxing W over Q (which is what Riot probably intended) with CDR means you can get a potential true damage 250+ hit by level 9 every 6 seconds which gives a massive shield too which also lasts potential 3 second, so it's back up again in 3 seconds. :P
I seriously hope nobody was actually maxing Q first.

I went q > e > w and won 18/20 games. Lol. Doing that, it felt like his weaknesses were having no waveclear and having no poke. The all ins were great, but everything else sucked. The first time I maxed w he definitely felt like a bullshit champ. Lol
They once said (Galio or Ryze Rework I think) that they do design it as QEW maxing order, a lot of champion combos also go that way. When a champ breaks it I'd say it's something they didn't expect.

> [{quoted}](name=Jaspers,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2020-01-24T11:39:28.647+0000)
>
> You mean people have worked out how to play him. Now they know that his regen passive keeps him safe in lane and maxing W over Q (which is what Riot probably intended) with CDR means you can get a potential true damage 250+ hit by level 9 every 6 seconds which gives a massive shield too which also lasts potential 3 second, so it's back up again in 3 seconds. :P

No. Q max win rate also shot up with the release of the new patch (though it is true that W max is now rightfully more popular than Q max).

“Wow after Aphelios, Riot finally made a non-bloated clear weakness champion” - Reddit neckbeards on release day

Lmao, Sett is fucking more insane than Aphelios.
At least Sett can’t snipe you repeatedly from across the map or insta kill the entire enemy team with one button.

You're right, he does it at melee range in AoE with true damage and huge ass shield to boot while also being hard AF to kill. 
Both him and Aphelios are overtuned but at least when im against aphelios i know 1 CC is all my team needs to kill him.

> [{quoted}](name=JackMcCarry,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2020-01-24T14:51:29.555+0000)
>
> You're right, he does it at melee range in AoE with true damage and huge ass shield to boot while also being hard AF to kill. 
> Both him and Aphelios are overtuned but at least when im against aphelios i know 1 CC is all my team needs to kill him.

Yeh Sett whill live through that CC then turn around and pop your team for 1000-1500 aoe true damage as a tank lol... all the while having a shield bigger than a Neeko Ulti.... on a low'ish CD.

Might I add that setting up your E into auto/Q/auto/Titanic/Auto W inside a bard ulti is a thing of fucking beauty?

People act like just because a champion is melee he cant be oppressive, just like Aphelios is annoying with his constant poke, Sett doing 1000 true damage every 9 seconds in AoE while getting a huge shield aswell is just as annoying, but the boards always have a very biased opinion on this subject, just like how you can post "melee good ranged bad" and get people circlejerking in the comments like crazy.

> [{quoted}](name=JackMcCarry,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-24T15:07:36.324+0000)
>
> People act like just because a champion is melee he cant be oppressive, just like Aphelios is annoying with his constant poke, Sett doing 1000 true damage every 9 seconds in AoE while getting a huge shield aswell is just as annoying, but the boards always have a very biased opinion on this subject, just like how you can post "melee good ranged bad" and get people circlejerking in the comments like crazy.

To me it seems most of the boards also forget it's not League of 1v1. All Sett needs is for ANYONE on his team to land a single cc.

Considering how popular Leona/Morgana/Lux ect are... it's not like that's not going to happen.

About the most disgusting thing I've seen so far was a Yuumi riding a Sett with a Glacial Augment Senna Mid.

> [{quoted}](name=JackMcCarry,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-24T15:07:36.324+0000)
>
> People act like just because a champion is melee he cant be oppressive, just like Aphelios is annoying with his constant poke, Sett doing 1000 true damage every 9 seconds in AoE while getting a huge shield aswell is just as annoying, 

Having you tried just ignoring him till everyone else is dead? Like Sett is easily 1 v 1able by most bruisers and skirmishers in the game and he doesn't really do much if you just run past him and kill his teammates .

What do you mean ignoring him? He's not a tank who deals no damage, did you miss the part where he deals 1000+ true damage in AoE and has a pretty substantial AoE CC? and ult? idk what kind of sett players  you've encountered, if i "run past him" to go for his team mates, he will either:
A> Grab me by his pull and either stun me or pull me back
B> Ult me back into my team (if im a front liner who goes for his backline)
C> Go for my team mates who will probably die because, again, he's not a tank, he's a Juggernaut, you cant ignore him, just like you cant ignore Darius or Illaoi.

> [{quoted}](name=JackMcCarry,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=0003000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2020-01-24T21:36:21.934+0000)
>
> did you miss the part where he deals 1000+ true damage in AoE

I think you should read what his W does.

Yea, he needs to take damage, so what you're suggesting it have my entire team ignore him, go for his team mates, and shrug off his CC, his auto attacks and his ult.

Good counterplay man, what a joke of an excuse for his winrate "just have your entire team ignore the Juggernaut's thats running around your team"

> [{quoted}](name=JackMcCarry,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=000300000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-24T21:48:32.096+0000)
>
> Yea, he needs to take damage, so what you're suggesting it have my entire team ignore him, go for his team mates, and shrug off his CC, his auto attacks and his ult.

Yes, he sucks if you ignore him. He isn't like Morde/Darius who is gonna blow you up if you ignore them.
It wasn't just Reddit, he had a lot of people downvoting anyone who even slightly implied some part of his kit might be problematic here too.

> [{quoted}](name=Sewer Side,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2020-01-24T12:43:40.001+0000)
>
> “Wow after Aphelios, Riot finally made a non-bloated clear weakness champion” - Reddit neckbeards on release day
> 
> Lmao, Sett is fucking more insane than Aphelios.

Sett's easier to deal with than Aphelios, his insane W is the issue. Aphelios's entire kit(s) is his issue.

I think it’s because people figured out itemization, especially Triforce after Tiamat. 

I don’t think he is bad design at all I think he could benefit from tweaks to his numbers. Also Triforce is slowly killing Black Cleaver

> [{quoted}](name=FurriesAreHot,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2020-01-24T13:57:11.868+0000)
>
> I think it’s because people figured out itemization, especially Triforce after Tiamat. 
> 
> I don’t think he is bad design at all I think he could benefit from tweaks to his numbers. Also Triforce is slowly killing Black Cleaver

Nope. His win rate with {{item:3071}} first item also shot up. As did builds that skip {{item:3077}} . The win rate increase is more or less independent of build (though better builds are still better).
feels like something is wrong lol
For real. Feels like plenty of loses were just dropped from the data.
what is that now, like 20 champions we need to permaban forever?
Went from “setts the most balanced champion on release” to “setts pick or ban” real quick lol

> [{quoted}](name=Akali Prime,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2020-01-24T19:03:06.075+0000)
>
> Went from “setts the most balanced champion on release” to “setts pick or ban” real quick lol

Because these boards are trash.

Took me 20+ games but I finally got to play Sett for the first time.... and JESUS is he ever busted. 11/4/6 with highest damage in game going full tank + titanic... Easy 1v2 top lane while getting ganked. Busted AF.

https://imgur.com/a/j9xaHCt

I mean I don't think I've ever done well my first game playing a champ....

Interesting fact... unlike Mundro/Garen Sett's passive is HEALTH REGEN. So when you just stack Rejuv beads.. you suddenly have stupid high health regen in lane. I did 4 rejuvs/dorans/boots and it felt like I had an activated warmogs at level 4. It's so silly I was taking tower shots on purpose by level 5 to poke with my W between waves.. and I was full hp by the time the next wave came.
Yeah, I wish I had that kind of health regen early-mid game as Trundle, especially while rushing Titanic into tank items.

> [{quoted}](name=Lovelle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2020-01-24T16:48:14.947+0000)
>
> Yeah, I wish I had that kind of health regen early-mid game as Trundle, especially while rushing Titanic into tank items.

Testing him in a bot game not that long ago I was seeing like 40 hp regen at times like 6-7 minutes into the game. :x His passive + rejuv beads absolutely shits on other passive sustains like Trundle/Garen/Cho'gath/Mundo. It's in the order of 3x as strong or more.

No champion should have that much passive sustain in lane. Hell his regen along is stronger than what most ADC's get with a heal support. Quite a bit so. With the size of his shield, and his OP regen it's like trying to deal with a champ that starts with a free warmogs.

I mean sure he can be kited for days by Champs like Teemo/Vayne/Quinn/Victor ect... but the moment he gets a gank they explode.
I've only seen pick and lose, honestly. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}
Im glad i feel this champ is just too bs. I was fucking garen, and i was avoiding all of his w true dmg. Yet i still couldnt outdamage him. His q and passive just bring him too much unavoidable dmg.

Wow. Someone who actually figured out how to link stats. And they **actually support the argument for once**. No pointless insulting, no random nonsense. Straight, to the point, and actually tells the truth.

Is this...an actual **quality post?**

Who would have thought? all those people circle jerking how he cant be OP because he has no dashes and he's melee were wrong?

Almost like this exact thing happened before when morde was reworked
"but he has no dashes! he's only melee! just kite him!"

 Watch as the same people now excuse his high winrate on first patch by saying "Well, he's easy to learn so it's okay! you just need to learn to play against him"
Morde only became OP after Conq got changed. Dont try to change the narrative.

> [{quoted}](name=Ragnaveil,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2020-01-24T16:05:49.376+0000)
>
> Morde only became OP after Conq got changed. Dont try to change the narrative.

You're the one changing the narrative. People always liked Morde but never played him because his kit was crap. He's always been popular, and his kit's always been good since the rework.

The original Mord was actually rather popular.... his player base left after his first rework...
Ya know the failed and laughable attempt to make him an ADC?

> [{quoted}](name=The Bad Touch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=0008000000010000,timestamp=2020-01-24T17:28:01.606+0000)

There may have been a time, but he's always been UNPOPULAR and considered bad when I got here in preseason five up until the juggs patch rework, and then he was considered "Usually bad but sometimes aight but we def don't want to touch this dude" until his VGU.

> [{quoted}](name=chipndip1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=00080000000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-24T17:42:33.230+0000)

There may have been a time, but he's always been UNPOPULAR and considered bad when I got here in preseason five up until the juggs patch rework, and then he was considered "Usually bad but sometimes aight but we def don't want to touch this dude" until his VGU.

I started back in late beta and he was pretty damn popular all the way up until I quit at the start of season 6.

> [{quoted}](name=The Bad Touch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U2ymzfyE,comment-id=000800000001000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-24T18:37:34.659+0000)
>
> I started back in late beta and he was pretty damn popular all the way up until I quit at the start of season 6.

Sentiment around him, maybe, but not his pick rate. His old kit (and its initial rework) were low play rate picks since I started playing in preseason 5, save the stint it was beyond busted during the juggy patch.

You're wrong, not only did he get hotfix nerfed (despite everyone saying it will gutt him) he was also FURTHER nerfed a couple of patches after ( again, saying those changes will gutt him), after conq change he just got back up to OP tier after a while of setteling on being just "good" (the horror) which made him get nerfed AGAIN.

 
> Dont try to change the narrative.

I just dont have selective memory, and i remember when morde was reworked specificely because of how biased i noticed the boards are towards him

Here are some of the nerfs he got hotfixed right after release (patch 9.12):

> BASE ATTACK DAMAGE 65 ⇒ 61
> BASE ARMOR 39 ⇒ 37
> MAGIC RESIST GROWTH 1.5 ⇒ 1.25
> ARMOR GROWTH 4 ⇒ 3
> PASSIVE - DARKNESS RISE DAMAGE 10-35.5 (1-6.1% of target's maximum health) (levels 1-18) ⇒ 8-25 (1-5% of target's maximum health) (levels 1-18)
> PASSIVE - DARKNESS RISE MOVEMENT SPEED 5-10% at levels 1-6 ⇒ 3/6/9% at levels 1/6/11

Patch 9.14:

> Even after 9.12's hotfixes, Mordekaiser is too strong. We're following up with some additional adjustments, pulling some power out of his damage amplification in the mid-game and his passive damage overall.
> 
> Passive - Darkness Rise
> BASE DAMAGE8-25 (levels 1-18) ⇒ 5-15 (levels 1-18)
> E - Death's Grasp
> MAGIC PENETRATION5/10/15/20/25% ⇒ 5/7.5/10/12.5/15%

Yet, after all these patches, he remained S/S+ Tier from as far as patch 9.22 (the oldest i can check on U.GG) until patch 10.1, where he got nerfed YET AGAIN tuning im down finally.
Patch 10.1:

> For a juggernaut, Mordekaiser is too hard to get away from and kite. That coupled with his synergy with Rylai's makes it difficult to escape from him.
> Passive - Darkness Rise
> DURATION5 seconds ⇒ 4 seconds
> MOVEMENT SPEED3/6/9% (levels 1/6/11) ⇒ 3% (levels 1-18)

Tell me how im the one with the wrong narative, he got nothing but nerfs since his release, some pretty major nerfs, yet until the latest one he kept on being S+ tier in toplane with high pickrate/winrate combo.
Or you can downvote anyone who says you're wrong
Sett is basically Vi, but with a better passive, stronger skills, hard CC, his ult does AOE damage instead of single target... what could go wrong? {{sticker:sg-lulu}}

[https://u.gg/lol/tier-list?rank=master_plus](https://u.gg/lol/tier-list?rank=master_plus)

Meanwhile in actual high Elo he has the 43rd best win rate and even if you throw out all the low pick rate champs he is still 5th among meta top laners. 

Sett is in a really weird spot for a new champ. He isn't that hard to pick up and learn, but at the same time people are still refusing to play correctly against him. Like they seem to be under the impression you focus him first in a teamfight.
You shouldnt make conclusions from 18 matches played statistics.
Since when? I mean, I've only ever played with and against people who just don't understand how Sett's abilities work, so...

Meh, he is strong, but I don't think he is busted. Illaoi gets pretty free wins vs him most of the time if you want a counterpick.
His w is the only overtuned part tho.
Honestly every sett player I've seen ends up with near even but high kills and deaths so like 11/11 bc he is pure garbage vs ranged honestly so his post lane is pretty bad unless he gets the ideal 2k true dmg w proc in a teamfight where people think they can just kill him

I think Sett is for the most part fine, the biggest issue is that his W is an extreme anti-meta ability that outright counters the unga bunga burst damage meta that is the whole game currently.

He doesnt have a good match-up in lane against popular picks (Darius, Morde, Fiora, Aatrox, etc all have great laning vs him) and he gets hardcountered by any adc with mobility. The thing is, the moment he can ditch laning to teamfight and is 2 items in, he outright punishes the fast bursty teamfights that are meta currently by taking all that damage and hard nuking people back with it.

If the game had proper places for poke or disengage teams like before, Sett couldnt be anywhere near as strong as he is currently. He is just a reflection of how damagecrept is the currently and how a single CC (even soft CC) can end up in a team getting aced.

I still don't see him even that strong his strengths is his safe laning and w but after all of that he really lack a strong engage even with his q it not enough to catch up with anyone.

I'm betting alot people still have no idea how to fight him and just standing dead middle infront him everytime they fight him.

Looking things over, his win rate shot way up with the release of the new patch with no particular reason. Which means one of two things: either he is bugged on the new patch or he was bugged on the old and the bug got fixed.
His kit is fine. His numbers need some hefty adjusting though
